result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian R. Bentz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 12-8-15 bond hearing. Return to sender Not deliverable as addreessed.

dated 12/16/15 to B.R.B. from Atty. Bliss - stj
includes 15CM2001, 15CM2052, 15CM2146 & 15CM2145

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:19 pm 
INCLUDES 15CM2001, 15CM2052, 15CM2145, AND 15CM2146. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty John Bliss.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CM2052: Ct. 1 (MIsd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM2145: Ct. 1 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM2146: Ct. 1 (DC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                       : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: In 15CM2001: Ct. 1 (Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                                  : Ct. 2 (DC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: On both counts>>9 months MCJ w/ huber for work if def qualifies to run concurrent and with 15 days jail credit; DNA sample and surcharge; CC w/ 60 days to pay or payment plan. 

Adj: 3:29 pm

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:21 am 
INCLUDES 15CM2001, 15CM2052, 15CM2145, AND 15CM2146. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty John Bliss. 
Atty Bliss notes deft turned himself in on Sunday and states deft may NOT have notice of FPT. 
State notes no object to bond forfeiture being vacated as deft turned himself in and parties have an agreement. 
COURT vacates bond forfeiture. 
CC set for 12/9/2015 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA to reset plea hearing. 
Bond continues. 
Adj: 9:24 am

INCLUDES 15CM2001, 15CM2052, 15CM2145, & 15CM2146 No contact with victim(s):  J.R., L.S., J.F.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.

defendants Notice of Motion & Motion for the production of Excupatory Evidence
includes 15cm2145, 15cm2146

Defendants Demand for Discovery & Inspection
includes 15cm2145,  15cm2146

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:48 pm 
INCLUDES 15CM2001, 15CM2052, 15CM2145, AND 15CM2146. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft does NOT appear - Atty John Bliss appears on his behalf. 
Date and time was set for plea hearing in 15CM2001 and 15CM2052. 
COURT notes notice was given to deft in all files. 
COURT authorizes $1500 bench warrant and orders bonds forfeited. 
BFH set for 12/8/2015 at 9am in Br. 3. 
Adj: 3:52 pm
